title: Prohibits pharmacists from refusing to dispense medication solely for philosophical, moral, or religious reasons
summary: Prohibits pharmacists from refusing to dispense medication solely for philosophical, moral, or religious reasons.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                          894

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sen. KRUEGER -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Higher Education

       AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation  to  prohibiting  pharma-
         cists  from  refusing to dispense medication solely for philosophical,
         moral, or religious reasons

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Section  6810 of the education law is amended by adding a
    2  new subdivision 10 to read as follows:
    3    10. NO PHARMACIST SHALL REFUSE TO DISPENSE OR REFILL A PRESCRIPTION OR
    4  MEDICATION ORDER SOLELY ON THE GROUNDS THAT TO DISPENSE  OR  REFILL  THE
    5  PRESCRIPTION OR MEDICATION ORDER WOULD CONTRAVENE THE PHARMACIST'S PHIL-
    6  OSOPHICAL, MORAL, OR RELIGIOUS BELIEFS.
    7    S 2. This act shall take effect on the first of November next succeed-
    8  ing the date on which it shall have become a law.






        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD00813-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation to prohibiting pharmacists from refusing to dispense medication solely for philosophical, moral, or religious reasons
